Mini 1589: Train of Death

The train glides over the tracks as the realization sets in. You are trapped. You glance around the car nervously, there are twelve others with you here. Their intentions unknown to you, but many of them appear to be very shady characters, much like yourself. What will happen next, remains unknown to you. But a sigh of relief creeps over you as the sun can be seen out the window, rising. But there is no escape, only death. Something must be done or you will most certainly face a very painful death.

Rules


Basic:
1.1: All site rules apply.
1.2: My word is law. I can change and add any rules at any time.
1.3: If I make a mistake or you have a question, please contact me through PM.
1.4: Be nice and respectful to everyone.
1.5: This [#800000] is my color, do not use it.

Game:
2.1: You may not discuss the game outside of this thread, unless you have been given permission and only in the areas designated by myself.
2.2: When you are dead, you are dead. You may not post anymore.
2.3: You may not quote your Role PM or any private communication.
2.4: You may not edit posts.
2.5: You may use spoilers to hide long posts, etc.
2.6: You may not use spoilers or anything else to intentionally hide text from players.

Day:
3.1: The day phase will last for 10 days. Extensions may be granted.
3.2: The day will end once the deadline has elapsed or a lynch has been achieved.
3.3: Lynches are achieved when a majority of the players are voting for a person.
3.4: If a majority has not been achieved by the deadline, nobody will be lynched.
3.5: Each player is expected to post a minimum of once every 48 hours. Failure to do so will result in a prod.
3.6: Players have 24 hours to respond to prods in-thread. Accumulating four or more prods may result in a player being replaced.
3.7: Daytalk is enabled for all factions by default.

Night:
4.1: The night phase will last for 48 hours. Extensions may be granted.

Voting:
5.1: When voting must use vote tags or bold it.
5.2: You may vote for a No Lynch.
5.3: Unvoting is unecessary.
5.4: Votes must not be hidden.
5.5: When voting, I must be able to discern who it's for or it won't count.

Spoiler: Town Vanilla Role PM
Welcome, Aronis! You are a Town Vanilla.

Abilities: During the day you may talk and vote.

Win Condition: You win once all anti-town players have been eliminated and at least one town remains.


Please confirm in-thread.
All Role PMs have been sent. Players have 24 hours to confirm in-thread. The game will begin when 11/13 players have confirmed.

That being said, Nat's play hasn't been great, which worries me, but the Espresso wagon trumps that, I think. I also agree with you in the SK/Junpei are playing pretty townie-like. You've also got the report for SK and the rofl credentials for Junpei, both of which are as good as gold.

Alright, let's look at Nat's interaction with the Espresso wagon in detail. Before it, he voted Fusion, claiming it as a shameless sheep. We can ask the question then: how would scum-Nat react to a wagon on their last scumbuddy? Well, scum-Nat certainly couldn't ignore it, as that would create a stark contrast between willingness to blindly sheep on Fusion and unwillingness to blindly sheep on Espresso if Espresso flips scum. So, what would be a reasonable course of action? Going all-in with the phrase "200% fine with powerlynching" seems to make more sense than limping into the wagon. Sure, after that it was a weak bus, but that leaves Nat with an out if the wagon goes away, which is entirely feasible to have happened after the Fusion wagon earlier. It's quite possible that Nat was trying to just look like a generically sheeping townie, and thus treated the Fusion and Espresso wagons similarly. That isn't really an argument for Nat-scum in and of itself, but it is an argument that the Espresso wagon makes sense from that point of view. Nat also later said:

Colorized, and not my Espresso lead is less due to actually scumreading and more due to me having my vote there.

And then later he unvoted after the hammer. I think it's fair to assume Nat didn't realize the hammer had fell (regardless of alignment). There's no clear reason to make the unvote otherwise. So, Nat-town unvoting doesn't particularly make sense or not make sense. It's feasible. Nat-scum unvoting might look odd, but I can think of multiple lines of reasoning to justify it. Nat could have thought the pattern of the day was a bunch of wagons being built up and torn down, and wanted to continue that pattern in a way that wouldn't get espresso lynched. Nat could have had second thoughts about lynching the only other scum. Nat might have wanted to leave the wagon for some kind of wifom value. They're certainly not the most cogent reasons, but I think they're certainly reasonable.

All my cards on the table? I'm actually much more worried about SK than I am Nat, implosion. But I really like your post here. After all my bloviated posting yesterday, it turns out I'm the stick-in-the-mud that feels something bad gnawing at my stomach.
